Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section with many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26-27/843 The North Suburb, The South Western Quarter, House T.36.10.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393467) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393467)
